intro: Pfaffia ninae, commonly known as the dwarf guaraná, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenia. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. Pfaffia ninae is often found growing in shaded, humid environments within the undergrowth of the rainforest. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and pharmacological research.
